other_tests.findings: The patient developed a symptomatic Epstein–Barr virus (EBV) infection concurrent with immunosuppressant drug therapy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative immunosuppression was ceased, leading to stabilization of blood values and the resolution of prolonged fever, but the patient is predisposed to developing posttransplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) and will require lifelong monitoring.

other_tests.findings: Elevated anti–Epstein Barr viral capsid antigen IgG and IgM levels, absence of Epstein–Barr nuclear antigen antibodies, and the presence of viral DNA by PCR amplification.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The findings indicated a recent EBV infection; however, the diagnosis of PTLD was not established, but recurrence of lymphocytosis and neutropenia was observed during FK-506 therapy.
